details.title: Gym owners across India continue facing lockdown heat
details.content:
Tamil Nadu: Gym owners & trainers in Chennai say they're facing hardships amid #COVID19 pandemic as gyms are closed. JK Ravi, a gym owner, says, "I tried to manage till June but I can't buy pay rent anymore. Surviving has become difficult as all my savings have exhausted". (9.7) pic.twitter.com/OMp0w65tPM

— ANI (@ANI) July 9, 2020

details.title: Now, isolation coaches set up at Patna Railway Junction
details.content:
Bihar: Isolation wards have been set up at Patna Junction railway station for #COVID19 patients. These wards have 640 beds. (9.7) pic.twitter.com/WyaKPnrpVy

— ANI (@ANI) July 9, 2020

details.title: First ever Plasma Therapy in J&K
details.content: Sher-i-Kashmir Institute of Medical Sciences (SKIMS), Soura conducted the first ever Plasma for COVID-19 patients—a medical procedure, doctors are using to treat novel Coronavirus diseases across the globe: SKIMS, Srinagar.

details.title: News from Odisha
details.content:
Odisha Govt revised "Special COVID Fee" of 50% imposed on alcoholic beverages, rationalisation will be done in such a manner that MRPs of various IMFL/ Beer/Wine/ RTD brands will be hiked in the range of around 15% over the prevailing MRP of 2019-20: State Excise Dept (9/7) pic.twitter.com/H2jo908QA0

— ANI (@ANI) July 9, 2020

details.title: Delhi to speed up rapid anitgen testings
details.content:
In continuation of measures undertaken to augment #COVID19 testing, it has been decided that Rapid Antigen Detection tests will be offered by all Delhi Govt dispensaries&polyclinics from 9 am to 12 noon on all days to all eligible individuals with immediate effect: Delhi Govt pic.twitter.com/4KcIwFE4kT

— ANI (@ANI) July 9, 2020

details.title: Latest Assam numbers
details.content: 568 new COVID-19 patients recorded in Assam on Thursday, with 355 patients from Guwahati city. Total number cases now at 14600 including 9147 discharged cases, 5423 active cases and 27 deaths: State Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma.

details.title: 76 new cases in Jharkhand
details.content: 76 new COVID-19 positive cases reported in Jharkhand on Thursday, taking the total number of cases to 3,268 including 1,035 active cases, 2,210 recovered/discharged and 23 deaths.

details.title: News from Karnataka
details.content:
Separate registration/permission for such hotels not required but arrangement shall be duly informed to concerned Dist health & family welfare/Chief Health Officer-BBMP officer via a letter/e-mail. It'll be joint responsibility of pvt medical establishment & hotel: Karnataka Govt https://t.co/BFR5ToEhWd

— ANI (@ANI) July 9, 2020

details.title: 112 new cases in Goa
details.content: 112 COVID-19 positive cases, 66 cured in Goa on Thursday. The total number of positive cases in the state rises to 2151, including 1273 recovered cases and nine deaths.

details.title: Latest Himachal numbers
details.content: The total number of COVID-19 positive cases in the state stands at 1,140 including 833 cured and nine deaths.

details.title: UP lockdown order
details.content:
All offices, markets and commercial establishments will remain closed. However, essential services will be allowed. Trains will continue to operate: UP Government #Lockdown pic.twitter.com/7rUHYXnT8a

— ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) July 9, 2020

details.title: Rajasthan numbers till Thursday night
details.content:
500 #COVID19 positive cases, 9 deaths, 204 recovered and 219 recovered till 8:30 PM today in Rajasthan. The total number of positive cases in the state stands at 22,563 including 491 deaths, 17,070 recovered and 16,712 discharged: State Health Department pic.twitter.com/rXhlZ0eYln

— ANI (@ANI) July 9, 2020

details.title: ICMR's letter giving August 15 deadline for COVAXIN aimed at expediting trials: Government
details.content: The Drugs Controller General of India (DCGI) has permitted two vaccines -- one developed by the Bharat Biotech International Limited in collaboration with ICMR and another by Zydus Cadila Healthcare Ltd -- to go in for phase 1 and 2 human clinical trials, said Rajesh Bhushan, Officer on Special Duty in the health ministry. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: WATCH | Encouraging fall in Chennai's COVID-19 positivity rate, but can the trend hold?
Most models focus on how virus behaves, not other factors: Centre on MIT's claims of daily 2.87 lakh cases in India by December 2021
details.content: The Health Ministry also said instead of spending a lot of time on these models, focussing on containment, surveillance, testing and treatment will give better results. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: WATCH | COVID-19: This Odisha man spreads awareness by revamping damaged bikes
Indoor airborne spread of COVID-19 possible: WHO changes its corona stance
details.content: In an open letter published this week in a journal, two scientists from Australia and the US wrote that studies have shown "beyond any reasonable doubt that viruses are released during exhalation, talking and coughing in microdroplets small enough to remain aloft in the air." (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: ICMR plans pan-India survey to determine exposure of population to coronavirus
details.content: The final results of the sero-survey conducted by the ICMR in May, which focused on infections of mid-April is still under process, Rajesh Bhushan, Officer on Special Duty in the Union Health Ministry said on Thursday. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: India registers its highest daily case load
details.content: India oreports 475 deaths and the highest single-day spike of 26,506 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours. Positive cases stand at 7,93,802 including 2,76,685 active cases, 4,95,513 cured/discharged/migrated & 21,604 deaths: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare.

details.title: India registers its highest daily case load
details.content: India reports 475 deaths and the highest single-day spike of 26,506 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours. Positive cases stand at 7,93,802 including 2,76,685 active cases, 4,95,513 cured/discharged/migrated & 21,604 deaths: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare.

details.title: Puducherry tally crosses 1200
details.content: Number of COVID-19 cases reaches 1,272 in Puducherry; active cases stand at 618: Puducherry Health Department.

details.title: India's COVID tally climbs to 7,93,802 as country registers record 26,506 new cases in 24 hours
details.content: The number of recoveries stands at 4,95,512 while there are 2,76,685 active cases of coronavirus infection presently in the country, the updated data at 8 am showed. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: WHO experts to spend two days in Beijing as part of COVID-19 origin investigation
details.content: One animal health expert and one epidemiologist during their visit will work to fix the "scope and terms of reference" for the future mission aimed at learning how the virus jumped from animals to humans, the statement from the United Nations body said. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

— ANI (@ANI) July 10, 2020

details.content: People living in the area, which is under triple lockdown, demanded re-opening of shops selling necessary food items to meet their needs. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Union Health Minister on COVID-19 situation in India
details.content:
Around 2.7 lakh tests are being done daily. Despite being such a large country, we've not reached the community transmission stage of COVID-19. Though there are some small pockets where there could be slightly higher transmission locally: Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan (2/2) https://t.co/03VgM1N1iN

— ANI (@ANI) July 10, 2020

details.title: Karnataka CM in home quarantine after three staffers test positive for COVID-19
details.content: In a statement issued on Friday afternoon, Yediyurappa said that he was healthy and will continue to work from his residence. The Chief Minister will remain in home quarantine till next week as protocol mandates. Three persons -- an electrician, a standby driver and a pilot vehicle staffer -- have tested positive for COVID-19. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Why reveal names of COVID-19 patients? it involves privacy: Bombay High Court
details.content: The Bombay High Court on Friday sought to know why should the names of persons who have tested positive for COVID-19 be disclosed and said the issue involves privacy rights of such patients.

details.title: Odisha's COVID-19 tally rises to 11,956, toll climbs to 56
details.content: Odisha on Friday registered its highest single-day spike of 755 COVID-19 cases, taking the tally to 11,956, while the death toll mounted to 56 with four more patients succumbing to the infectious disease, a health department official said.

details.title: Tablighi Jamaat: Delhi court grants bail to 82 Bangladeshi nationals
details.content: A Delhi court Friday granted bail to 82 Bangladeshi nationals who were chargesheeted for attending Tablighi Jamaat congregation here for allegedly violating visa conditions, indulging in missionary activities illegally and violating government guidelines, issued in the wake of COVID-19 outbreak.

details.title: Rs 500 fine for violating COVID-19 protocols: Meghalaya CM
details.content: Meghalaya Chief Minister Conrad K Sangma said that the state government has decided to impose fine of Rs 500 on people who violate the COVID-19 safety protocols which include social distancing, wearing of mask, not spitting in public places.

details.title: Rahul seeks cancellation of varsity exams, says promote students on past performance
details.content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday demanded cancellation of university exams and urged the UGC to promote students on the basis of past performance during the coronavirus pandemic.

details.title: SC refuses to entertain plea for moratorium on school fees for lockdown period
details.content: The Supreme Court Friday refused to entertain a plea by parents from different states seeking deferment/moratorium on school fees for the COVID-19 lockdown period and asked them to approach the high courts for relief.

details.title: SC refuses to entertain plea for moratorium on school fees for lockdown period
details.content: The Supreme Court Friday refused to entertain a plea by parents from different states seeking deferment/moratorium on school fees for the COVID-19 lockdown period and asked them to approach the high courts for relief.

details.title: Karnataka CM Yediyurappa to 'work from home' after staff test positive for coronavirus
details.content: Karnataka Chief Minister BS Yediyurappa on Friday said he would work from home as a precautionary measure after some of the staff in his office- cum-residence here tested positive for coronavirus.

details.title: CISF official succumbs to COVID-19 in Mangalore; ninth death in the force
details.content: A 58-year-old official of the Central Industrial Security Force  has died due to the coronavirus infection, taking the death toll in the paramilitary force because of the disease to nine, officials said on Friday.

details.title: Delhi High Court suggests jail authorities consider video conferencing facility for prisoners, families
details.content: The Delhi High Court Friday suggested to the jail authorities to consider the requirement of prisoners for having video conferencing with their family for the duration when physical meetings in jails are suspended due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

details.title: Five more die due to COVID-19 in Assam, toll rises to 32
details.content: Five more people succumbed to COVID-19 in Assam, pushing the death toll to 32 in the state, Health and Family Welfare Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said on Friday.

details.title: Prohibitory order on fake social media posts not extended: Maharashtra government
details.content: The Maharashtra government on Friday informed the Bombay High Court that the prohibitory order against spreading of incorrect or false information on social media amid the COVID-19 pandemic has ended and no extension has been given to it.

details.title: 15 new COVID-19 cases in Arunachal Pradesh take total tally to 302
details.content: Arunachal Pradesh on Friday reported 15 new cases of COVID-19, taking the state's total tally to 302, a senior health official said. Seven of the new cases were detected in Changlang district, five were reported from Lower Subansiri, two from Leparada and one from Capital Complex which comprises Itanagar, Naharlagun, Nirjuli and Banderdewa towns.

details.title: With record spike of 1,803, Pune COVID-19 tally reaches 34,399
details.content: Pune district in Maharashtra reported its highest single-day spike of 1,803 new COVID-19 cases, which pushed its overall count to 34,399, a health official said on Friday. This single-day rise was reported on Thursday, he said. The death toll in the district reached 978 with 34 more people succumbing to the infection on Thursday, the official said.

details.title: AIADMK MLAs hold dharna in Puducherry legislative assembly premises, demand COVID-19 relief
details.content: AIADMK MLAs on Friday sat on a dharna in the lobby of the legislative assembly demanding COVID-19 relief for the people of Puducherry as was done by the Tamil Nadu government. (READ MORE)

Anjani Kumar, Commissioner of Police, #Hyderabad will be felicitating over 40 police personnel, who are #COVIDWarriors cum #COVIDsurvivors at a program in the city. @XpressHyderabad

Express Video | @RVKRao2 pic.twitter.com/NlM9BJqHsd

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) July 10, 2020

A man in AP's Visakhapatnam is taking his mother on a wheelchair to get her tested for #Covid_19. #AndhraFightsCorona @xpressandhra

Express Photo | @Gsn_tnie pic.twitter.com/6iipqEAkr5

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) July 10, 2020

details.title: Yet another TN Minister tests positive for COVID-19, 11 state MLAs infected so far
details.content: Minister for Cooperation Sellur K Raju on Friday tested positive for COVID-19. Sources said he is being treated at a private hospital in Chennai. Raju is the third minister to contract the virus. (READ MORE)

details.title: Roads deserted as people in Bengal stay indoors on second day of weeklong lockdown
details.content: Vast swathes of West Bengal wore a deserted look on Friday as most people preferred to stay indoors on the second day of the seven-day lockdown clamped on the state's containment zones.

details.title: Delhi manages to control COVID spike but experts cautious, say dip in cases has to be sustained
details.content: The national capital's COVID-19 count crossed the grim one lakh milestone this week but the number of active cases is dipping as is the positivity rate while the recovery rate is going up, raising hopes of the epidemic curve flattening if the trends continue.

details.title: Holding Bihar polls during pandemic may put people at risk, will lead to low turnout: LJP
details.content: BJP ally Lok Janshakti Party on Friday appeared to be in favour of postponing the Bihar assembly polls, with its president Chirag Paswan saying that voter turnout may be very low if the elections are held amid the spread of COVID-19, and put people at risk.

details.title: Plea in HC for waiving tuition fees as no physical classes held by schools during COVID-19 lockdown
details.content: A PIL has been moved in the Delhi High Court seeking directions to the AAP government to take steps for waiving tuition fees charged by schools in the national capital during the COVID-19 lockdown as no physical classes were held. The plea also seeks refund of the tuition fees paid by parents from April onwards.

details.title: Diamond trader in Gujarat kills self after testing COVID-19 positive
details.content: A day after testing positive for coronavirus, a diamond trader in Gujarat's Surat city allegedly committed suicide by jumping in front of a moving train on Friday, police said.

details.title: 26 more BSF personnel test COVID-19 positive in Meghalaya
details.content: Twenty-six more personnel of the BSF have tested positive for COVID-19 in Meghalaya, taking the number of infections in the border-guarding force in the state to 91, Chief Minister Conrad K Sangma said on Friday.

details.title: NIT develops multipurpose sanitising device to disinfect packed food items, currency
details.content: A timer-fitted sanitising device, which uses UV radiation to kill microbial pathogens, has been developed by the Dr B R Ambedkar National Institute of Technology in Jalandhar to disinfect a variety of articles including packed food and currency. The portable box-shaped gadget is fitted with ultra-violet lights on the top and at the bottom. It can sanitise packed food items and disinfect currency notes and credit cards besides sanitising papers, files, used masks and gloves, keys etc, the NIT said in a statement.

details.title: COVID-19 effect: Rajasthan govt planning to cut short school syllabus for this year
details.content: Taking a cue from the CBSE, the Rajasthan government is planning to cut short the syllabus for the current academic session on the basis of number of working days of schools.

details.title: School challenges circular to not deny online classes to students who can't pay fees: HC seeks reply
details.content: The Delhi High Court has sought the AAP government's response on a school's plea challenging its circular directing all schools not to deny ID and password for online classes to students who did not pay fees due to financial constraints.

details.title: Migrants are returning to the national capital to resume their work as commercial activities begin
details.content:
Delhi: Migrants are returning to the national capital to resume their work as commercial activities begin. A migrant says, "I had a job here but due to #COVID19 outbreak, I had to leave for my hometown. But now I have come back to work here." pic.twitter.com/mZw2L4i3qw

— ANI (@ANI) July 10, 2020

details.title: Andhra Pradesh reports 1,608 new COVID-19 cases
details.content: Andhra Pradesh reports 1,608 new COVID-19 cases and 15 deaths over last 24 hours. Total cases in the state climb to 25,422, out of which 11,936 are active patients: State Health Department

details.title: 352 new COVID-19 positive cases reported in Bihar today
details.content: 352 new COVID-19 positive cases reported in Bihar today taking the total tally in the state to 14,330 including 9792 recovered cases: Government of Bihar

details.title: 352 new COVID-19 positive cases reported in Bihar today
details.content: 352 new COVID-19 positive cases reported in Bihar today taking the total tally in the state to 14,330 including 9792 recovered cases: Government of Bihar

Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Edappadi K Palaniswami today held a meeting with the Central Committee at the Chief Secretariat regarding the preventive measures taken against #COVID19 in Tamil Nadu and the treatment provided to the infected persons: Tamil Nadu CMO pic.twitter.com/gPN02WPX3h

— ANI (@ANI) July 10, 2020

details.title: WATCH | Poonthura residents protest amid triple lockdown due to 'local transmission'
222 new COVID-19 positive cases reported in Maharashtra Police force in last 48 hours
details.content: 222 new COVID-19 positive cases and 3 deaths reported in the state Police force in the last 48 hours. The total number of positive cases in the Force now stands at 5,935 including 74 deaths and 4,715 recovered: Maharashtra Police

details.title: Penalty amount for not wearing face mask in public to  be raised from Rs 100 to Rs 500 in UP
details.content: We had announced that penalty amount for not wearing face mask in public would be raised from Rs 100 to Rs 500. A notification has been issued to this effect today: Uttar Pradesh Principal Health Secretary Amit Mohan Prasad

details.title: Delhi ​​​​​​​HC refuses to entertain plea challenging BCI notification on final year online law exams
details.content: The Delhi High Court Friday refused to entertain a petition challenging the Bar Council of India's notification directing the universities across the country to conduct final year law examinations through online mode.

details.title: Relaxations in buffer zones in Thiruvananthapuram, shops to be open till 5 pm
details.content: A few lockdown relaxations have been made in the buffer zones in Thiruvananthapuram city corporation. Fishing has been permitted as long as the catch is sold inside the buffer zones. Shops will be open here till 5 pm every day as part of the relaxations. (READ MORE)

details.title: COVID-19 tally crosses 25,000 in Andhra with 1,608 fresh cases, 15 more die
details.content: The COVID-19 tally in Andhra Pradesh crossed the 25,000 mark on Friday and now stands at 25,422 with a total 1,608 new cases confirmed out of 21,020 samples tested in the last 24 hours till 9 a.m. on Friday. (READ MORE)

details.title: Final year degree students to write exams in September, rest to be promoted: Karnataka government
details.content: In view of the COVID-19 pandemic, the Karnataka government has decided to promote all intermediate semester students pursuing degree and post-graduation courses, including engineering, and diploma courses for the academic year 2019-20 without examinations.

details.title: Over 1.6 lakh cases of lockdown violations registered in Maharashtra
details.content: Over 1.6 lakh offences have been registered and more than 29,000 people have been arrested for violating prohibitory orders during the COVID-19 lockdown in Maharashtra, state Home Minister Anil Deshmukh said on Friday.

details.title: India's COVID-19 case fatality rate dips to 2.72 per cent: Health Ministry
details.content: From 2.82 per cent a month earlier, India's COVID-19 case fatality rate has declined to 2.72 per cent which is lower than that of many other countries, the Union Health Ministry said on Friday. It also noted that 30 states and Union Territories have a fatality rate lower than the national average.

details.title: Conduct rapid antigen tests in every household: UP CM Yogi Adityanath to officials
details.content: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has asked officials to carry out rapid antigen tests in every household during the three-day special cleanliness campaign initiated from Friday.

details.title: NGT slams UP chief secretary for allowing brick kilns during COVID-19, terms it criminal offence
details.content: The National Green Tribunal has slammed the UP chief secretary for allowing brick kilns to operate in the state despite its prohibition during the coronavirus lockdown. The NGT said it was surprised how the Chief Secretary could have passed a contrary order in violation of the order of this tribunal which amounts to a criminal offence.

details.title: West Bengal tourism deptt reopens 10 facilities amid COVID-19 pandemic
details.content: The West Bengal tourism department has reopened at least 10 of its facilities in different parts of the state, even as the travel industry reels under the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic, an official said on Friday.

details.title: COVID-19: Pune to go on 10-day lockdown starting Jul 13
details.content: In a bid to stem the spread of COVID-19, a 10-day lockdown will be imposed in Pune, neighbouring Pimpri-Chinchwad and a few other parts of the district starting July 13, a senior official said on Friday. The lockdown will come into force from midnight of July 13 and end on July 23, he said.

Andhra Pradesh: Bodies allegedly of #COVID19 patients were seen being disposed of using earth moving machine in a viral video. Nellore Sub Divisional Magistrate, Hussain Saheb says, "We have taken cognisance of the matter. Further investigation underway." pic.twitter.com/0vEabmz6RM

— ANI (@ANI) July 10, 2020

Nurses working on outsourcing basis for close to 15 years at Gandhi Hospital in Hyderabad are protesting for regularisation of their jobs amid the #COVID__19 crisis. @XpressHyderabad @KrishnaRaoCHVM

Express Video | @Vinaymadapu pic.twitter.com/m0vqpXQny6

details.title: West Bengal tourism deptt reopens 10 facilities amid COVID-19 pandemic
details.content: The West Bengal tourism department has reopened at least 10 of its facilities in different parts of the state, even as the travel industry reels under the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic, an official said on Friday.

details.title: UP records highest single-day spike of 1,338 COVID-19 cases, tally rises to 33,700
details.content: The COVID-19 tally in Uttar Pradesh rose to 33,700 on Friday with the highest single-day spike of 1,338 cases, while the death toll reached 889 after 27 patients succumbed to the disease, a senior official said on Friday.

details.title: 'Total' lockdown extended till July 19 in Thane city
details.content: A lockdown with minimal exemptions that is in force in Thane city till July 12 has now been extended till July 19, a senior official said on Friday. The order was issued by Thane Municipal Corporation Additional Commissioner Ganesh Deshmukh.

details.title: Central team to assess COVID-19 situation in Tamil Nadu meets CM Edappadi K Palaniswami
details.content: A team, deputed by the Central government to assess the COVID-19 situation in Tamil Nadu, met Chief Minister K Palaniswami here on Friday and discussed the strategy to contain the spread of the virus.

details.title: Puducherry CM Narayanasamy rules out imposition of total lockdown on Sundays
details.content: Puducherry Chief Minister V Narayanasamy on Friday ruled out categorically imposition of total lockdown in the Union Territory on Sundays, saying it was not the 'exclusive solution' to check the spread of coronavirus.

Back to Business: Taking all the necessary precautions, employees of a store are seen cleaning windows and setting it up for business in Bengaluru.

Express Photos | @MeghanaSastry @XpressBengaluru pic.twitter.com/HIeiYaAfv7

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) July 10, 2020

details.content:
Kerala Covid update: 416 new Covid cases on Friday; Local transmission 204. From overseas 123, 51 other states. For the first time, local transmission cases beat cases from abroad and other states. @NewIndianXpress

— TNIE Kerala (@xpresskerala) July 10, 2020

details.title: Himachal Pradesh detects two new COVID-19 positive cases today
details.content:
Himachal Pradesh detects 2 new #COVID19 positive cases today, taking the total number of positive cases to 1,143 including 268 active, 851 recoveries and 9 deaths: State Health Department pic.twitter.com/T1WOJ5JN6g

— ANI (@ANI) July 10, 2020

details.title: Parliamentary Standing Committee on Science and Technology meets for first time since lockdown
details.content: The Parliamentary Standing Committee on Science and Technology, Environment and Climate Change on Friday met for the first time since the lockdown due to COVID-19 was enforced on March 25, with Rajya Sabha Chairman M Venkaiah Naidu expressing happiness over the development.

details.title: From 13-23 July there'll be lockdown in Pune: Shekhar Gaikwad
details.content: From 13-23 July there'll be lockdown in the city. It'll be in two phases - first between 13 to 18 July when only medical shops, dairies & hospitals will be allowed to remain open. Newspapers also allowed: Shekhar Gaikwad, Commissioner, Pune Municipal Commission

details.title: Punjab Government cancels pending examinations of class 12th
details.content: Punjab Government cancels pending examinations of class 12th. Punjab School Education Board to declare results on the basis of best-performing subjects formula: Government of Punjab

details.title: 'Get treated in govt hospitals': BJP and Congress leaders to COVID positive TN ministers
details.content: On a day when the third minister in the state tested positive for COVID-19 but preferred to be admitted to a private hospital, BJP and Congress leaders have urged them to get treatment at government hospitals. The statements come in the wake of widespread social media chatter on the issue. (READ MORE)

#COVID__19 restrictions in #Kerala capital including triple lockdown at containment zones to continue for one more week, says @CMOKerala @vijayanpinarayi @NewIndianXpress @xpresskerala

— anil s anilan (@anilsanilan) July 10, 2020

details.title: Zomato restores full salaries, says food delivery back to 60% of pre-COVID level
details.content: Online food delivery firm Zomato said that its core business has recovered to 60% of pre-COVID levels even though the Gross Merchandise Volume(GMV) hit its lowest point in two years (down by 80%) due to the pandemic in the last week of March 2020. (READ MORE)

details.title: Chennai fever camp data
details.content:
Here’s the Chennai fever camp data. 11,404 have tested positive upto July 8. @xpresstn @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/zBny1lzq5G

— Omjasvin M D (@omjasvinMD) July 10, 2020

details.title: Insurance companies launch short-term Corona Kavach policy
details.content: Sticking to the stiff deadline set by the regulator IRDAI, several insurance companies on Friday launched short-term 'Corona Kavach' health insurance policies to cover the treatment expenses of COVID-19. Amid rising cases of coronavirus in the country, the IRDAI had asked general and health insurance companies to launch 'Corona Kavach' health insurance policy for the benefit of the people by July 10.

details.title: Power cuts set to return to Chennai after disappearing during COVID-19 lockdown
details.content: For three months since the imposition of COVID-19 lockdown, there was one definite relief. Power cuts disappeared. But now Chennai residents will have to prepare for them all over again. (READ MORE)

details.title: Delhi updates
details.content:
Delhi registers 2089 new #COVID19 cases past 24 hours.
However recovery count continues to be more than fresh cases. 2468 recovered.
42 more fatalities.
22K plus tests done.@NewIndianXpress #coronavirus pic.twitter.com/5k97ZDZfxN

— Somrita Ghosh (@Somrita_Ghosh) July 10, 2020

New COVID cases crossed the 400-mark for the first time in a single-day for KL on Friday. The state saw local transmission cases outnumbering imported cases, a matter of serious concern for the administration. @AnujaRoy_TNIE brings the details.@MSKiranPrakash @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/tARRftYCeJ

— TNIE Kerala (@xpresskerala) July 10, 2020

details.title: Karnataka records biggest single-day spike of 2,313; toll crosses 500 mark
details.content: Karnataka on Friday reported the biggest single-day spike of 2,313 new COVID-19 cases and 57 related fatalities, taking the total number of infections to 33,418 and death toll to 543, the health department said. The day also saw a record 1,003 patients getting discharged after recovery. Out of 2,313 fresh cases reported, a whopping 1,447 cases were from Bengaluru urban alone.

details.title: Coronavirus cases in Gujarat cross 40,000 with another record rise
details.content: With the highest single-day spike of 875 new cases, the coronavirus case tally in Gujarat breached the 40,000-mark on Friday, the health department said. The number of coronavirus cases in the state rose to 40,155, it said in a release. 14 COVID-19 patients died since previous evening, taking the death toll to 2,024.

details.title: Intense outbreaks of new coronavirus can still be brought under control: WHO chief
details.content: Intense outbreaks of the new coronavirus can still be brought under control, World Health Organization chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said Friday, lamenting that global case numbers had more than doubled in the past six weeks. “There are many, many examples from around the world,” said Tedros, that even if the Covid-19 outbreak is “very intense, it can still be brought back under control”.

Ordered immediate replacement of Medical Superintendent of AIIMS Trauma Centre: Union Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan pic.twitter.com/2IfYP2KPS3

— ANI (@ANI) July 10, 2020

details.title: Short-term lockdowns not of any help in controlling COVID-19: AIIMS director
details.content: Short-term lockdowns will not be of any help in arresting the transmission of coronavirus, AIIMS Director Randeep Guleria said on Friday as cities like Pune in Maharashtra announced shutdowns of up to 10 days to stem the spread of the pandemic.

details.title: Chhattisgarh updates
details.content:
140 new #COVID19 positive cases and 2 deaths have been reported in Chhattisgarh today. Total number of positive cases rise to 3806 including 761 active cases, 3028 discharged cases and 2 deaths: State Health Department. pic.twitter.com/C1HDyI3Aej

— ANI (@ANI) July 10, 2020

details.title: Uttarakhand updates
details.content:
Uttarakhand ranks 2nd among states & union territories of the country in terms of recovery rate from Covid 19 infection, 8th in fatality rate according to data released by union ministry of health and family welfare on Friday. @NewIndianXpress @TheMornStandard @Sunday_Standard pic.twitter.com/ddJwexxfFj

— Vineet Upadhyay (@VineetTNIE) July 10, 2020

details.title: Record 1598-case spike takes Pune district count to 35,997
details.content: Pune district saw its highest 24- hour period jump in COVID-19 cases with 1,598 people testing positive for novel coronavirus, taking the count here to 35,997, an official said on Friday. The death toll crossed the 1000-mark and reached 1,007 as 28 people succumbed to the infection during the day, he added.

details.title: Union Health Minister tells TN to step up COVID-19 testing
details.content: The Centre on Friday advised the Tamil Nadu government to ramp up COVID-19 testing besides taking up other containment strategies. Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan, in a tweet, said the spurt in the number of COVID-19 positive cases in rural areas remains a point of concern.

details.title: Public transport service almost unaffected in Kolkata amid lockdown in containment zones
details.content: Public transport service in the city was largely unaffected on Friday with the main thoroughfares remaining open, even as containment zones were put under strict lockdown to check the spread of COVID-19, police said here. The number of private buses were, however, less compared to other days as a majority of transport workers hailing from the neighbouring districts could not join duty owing to the lockdown, Joint Council of Bus Syndicates general secretary Tapan Banerjee said.

details.title: WHO praises efforts to contain virus in Dharavi
details.content: "...Some examples are Italy, Spain and South Korea, and even in Dharavi - a densely packed area in the megacity of Mumbai - a strong focus on community engagement and the basics of testing, tracing, isolating and treating all those that are sick is key to breaking the chains of transmission and suppressing the virus," said the UN Health Body Chief at Geneva.

details.title: AIIMS-Patna declared as dedicated COVID-19 hospital
details.content: A total of 352 new cases of coronavirus were reported in Bihar on Friday, informed the State Health Department. With the addition of these new cases, the state tally of coronavirus cases has climbed to 14,330, including 9,792 recovered cases, said the health department.

details.title: Uttar Pradesh lockdown update
details.content:
Varanasi: Police personnel check IDs of people as they move about for their daily chores. Uttar Pradesh govt has imposed lockdown in the state from 10 pm on July 10 to 5 am on 13th July. All offices, markets & commercial establishments to remain closed,essential services allowed. pic.twitter.com/j23QLCZY2c

— ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) July 11, 2020

details.title: 1,500 Indians to be repatriated from South Africa on Sunday
details.content: This will be the second repatriation flight arranged by the India Club, an ethnic, socio-cultural group. Over 50 of the passengers are IT employees from Bengaluru who have been stuck in South Africa after their contracts with various local companies expired prematurely with businesses scaling down operations due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

details.title: Indore reports 89 new cases
details.content: The cumulative death toll due to COVID-19 in the district reached 261.

details.title: 936 new cases in Assam
details.content: Out of the total count, 521 positive cases have been reported from Guwahati alone. The total number of COVID-19 cases now stands at 15,536, including 5,650 active cases and 9,848 recoveries.

details.title: Centre has formed no Monitoring Committee
details.content:
This notice which claims that a #COVID19 Monitoring Committee has been formed is fake. Such a committee has not been set up by the Union Home Ministry. Beware of fake news and rumours: Spokesperson, Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) pic.twitter.com/L9Wp035vk1

— ANI (@ANI) July 11, 2020

details.title: NIT Calicut's hostel facility to become COVID facility
details.content:
Kozhikode to open its second Covid First-line Treatment Centre (CFLTC) today. The MBA hostel of @NITcalicut has converted to CFLTC with a bed capacity of 300.@xpresskerala

— Amiya Meethal (@amiya_TNIE) July 11, 2020

details.title: India records highest single-day spike
details.content:
India's COVID19 case tally crosses 8 lakh mark with 519 deaths and highest single-day spike of 27,114 new cases in the last 24 hours. Total positive cases stand at 8,20,916 including 2,83,407 active cases, 5,15,386 cured/discharged/migrated 22,123 deaths: Ministry of Health pic.twitter.com/zTiIgOyMxb

— ANI (@ANI) July 11, 2020

details.title: Goa rules out lockdown
details.content: Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant has ruled out the possibility of imposing further lockdowns in the coastal state, which is grappling with the rise in COVID- 19 cases. Speaking to a TV channel on Friday, Sawant said the process of unlocking has started and priority should be given to resume economic activities.

details.title: 55-hour lockdown begins in Agra
details.content: This period will be used to sanitise areas, step up cleanliness drive and screen people in the containment zones, health department officials said, early Saturday morning. With 17 fresh cases, Agra's tally now stands at 1,374. The death toll is 91, while 1,115 have been discharged after recovery. The number of active cases is 168. The recovery rate is 81.15 per cent.

The Palace has been closed after a relative of a Palace employee tested #COVID19 positive on July 9th. It will re-open on Monday. pic.twitter.com/JBWh47jYP2

details.content: At least 500 more beds will soon be made available for COVID-19 patients and this will take the bed capacity to 2,000 in Thane rural, district health officer Manish Renge said.

details.title: MMRDA spends Rs 53 cr on makeshift COVID hospital at BKC
details.content: The MMRDA has informed RTI activist Anil Galgali that it spent Rs 53 crore on account of constructing the COVID hospital in BKC. With 2,118 beds available in the facility, the expense of each bed is Rs 2,50,000. Galgali had sought information about the makeshift facility constructed in phase 1 and phase 2 by the MMRDA.

details.title: Rajasthan  death toll climbs to 499
details.content: Two COVID-19 fatalities and 170 cases were reported in Rajasthan on Saturday, taking the death toll to 499 and the total caseload to 23,344, according to an official report. The fresh deaths were reported from Jaipur and Ajmer, it stated. Among the new instances of coronavirus infection, the maximum 40 were reported from Alwar, followed by 33 from Jaipur.

details.title: 11 more cases reported in Nagaland
details.content: Out of the 310 samples tested in the last 24 hours, seven of them were reported from Kohima, three from Mon and one from Mokokchung.

details.content: A swab test conducted on Balakrishnan, a 79-year-old resident of Pulluvazhi near Perumbavoor in Ernakulam, who died on Friday night, turned positive on Saturday. He had been admitted to MOSC Medical College at Kolencherry on Friday morning with high fever. According to officials, he was a diabetes patient.(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: COVID-19 symptoms persist even after 60 days of recovery: Study
details.content: Among hospitalised patients in Italy recovering from COVID-19, 87.4 per cent have reported persistence of at least one symptom, particularly fatigue and dyspnea even after two months of being discharged from the hospital and very few were symptom-free, a study published in the Journal of the American Medical Association (JAMA) has found. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Centre advises cautious use of Remdesivir, Tocilizumab for Covid-19 treatment
details.content: id the reports of a mad rush for experimental drugs such as Remdesivir and Tocilizumab for Covid-19, the Centre has asked states and medical colleges across the country to focus mainly on standard care and cautioned against indiscriminate use of investigational therapies. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: WATCH | All Delhi state university exams cancelled due to COVID-19: Manish Sisodia
Are most COVID-19 patients in India being hospitalised unnecessarily?
details.content: A study, which documented details related to 406 patients in the Government Medical College, Kota and hospitals associated with it, has revealed that a majority of the patients -- 244 -- who were hospitalized had no symptoms at all and less than 5 per cent had severe respiratory issues requiring ICU or mechanical ventilation. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Kerala MP Shashi Tharoor makes five-point appeal to state on handling Poonthura unrest
details.content: People living in the area, which is under triple lockdown, had demanded re-opening of shops selling necessary food items to meet their needs. Over 100 residents of the fishermen hamlet had skirmishes with the police and special commando officers deployed at the spot. There were also reports of health workers who had visited the town to collect samples of COVID-19, reportedly being threatened, attacked and spit on by some locals. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Nagaland extends lockdown till July 31
details.content: The Nagaland government has decided to extend the ongoing lockdown in the state till July 31, and charge fees for COVID-19 tests and stay at quarantine centres at a later stage. The ongoing lockdown in the state, which was supposed to be lifted on July 16, was extended for another 15 days at a meeting of the High Powered Committee (HPC) on COVID-19 on Friday.

details.title: Bengal orders advanced equipment from European firm, aiming for 1 lakh daily
details.content: Aiming to conduct clinical examinations of at least one lakh COVID-19 samples daily, the West Bengal government has placed orders for advanced testing equipment from a Switzerland-based pharmaceutical company, an official said on Saturday. The device, which can conduct novel coronavirus tests on the Cobas 6800/8800 system, is being brought to the state via waterways and delivery is expected soon, the official said.

details.title: Karnataka government announces complete lockdown in Bengaluru
details.content:
Karnataka govt announces complete lockdown in Bengaluru Urban & rural districts starting 8 PM on July 14 till 5 AM on July 23.

Essential services will not be disrupted. No changes to scheduled exams says @CMofKarnataka officer@NewIndianXpress @santwana99 @XpressBengaluru

— Anusha Ravi Sood (@anusharavi10) July 11, 2020

details.title: Karnataka lockdown from July 14th to 22nd: CMO clarifies
details.content:
Karnataka Chief Minister's Office (CMO) issues clarification - lockdown to stay in effect till 5 am on 22nd July.

— ANI (@ANI) July 11, 2020

details.title: 2-day total lockdown in Shillong from Monday
details.content: The Meghalaya government on Saturday announced a two-day total lockdown in capital Shillong from Monday after the state reported the highest single-day spike of 97 COVID-19 cases. Chief Minister Conrad K Sangma said that the decision was taken to contain the spread of COVID-19, besides ensuring behavioural changes among citizens to follow coronavirus-related guidelines.

details.title: Assam's COVID-19 death toll reaches 36; tally climbs to 15,536
details.content: The death toll due to COVID-19 in Assam reached 36 after a 55-year-old patient succumbed to the disease on Saturday while the infection tally in the state climbed to 15,536, Health and Family Welfare Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said. The patient with a history of kidney ailment was intubated and ventilated when he was admitted in the ICU of Guwahati Medical College Hospital, where he died on Saturday morning, Sarma said.

details.title: Height of Ganesh idols restricted in Maharashtra amid coronavirus outbreak
details.content: With the shadow of coronavirus pandemic looming, the Maharashtra government on Saturday decided to restrict the height of idols installed by Ganpati Mandals to only four feet during the coming Ganesh festival. Even the Ganesh idols installed at home can not be taller than two feet, said a notification issued by the Home Department.(READ MORE)

details.title: Arunachal govt extends lockdown in capital complex till July 20
details.content: The Arunachal Pradesh government on Saturday extended the lockdown in the capital complex for another week till July 20 in view of the spurt in COVID-19 cases in the region. The state cabinet chaired by Chief Minister Pema Khandu took the decision to extend the total lockdown in the capital region till 5 am on July 20, Chief Secretary Naresh Kumar told reporters in a virtual press conference.

details.title: CRPF official succumbs to COVID-19 in Hyderabad; 11th pandemic death in force
details.content: A 51-year-old official of the Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) died due to coronavirus infection on Saturday taking the pandemic death toll in the country's largest paramilitary to eleven, officials said. The force also reported 58 fresh cases of the disease across its various units in the country. (READ MORE)

details.title: Amithab Bachchan tests COVID positive, hospitalised
details.content:
T 3590 -I have tested CoviD positive .. shifted to Hospital .. hospital informing authorities .. family and staff undergone tests , results awaited ..
All that have been in close proximity to me in the last 10 days are requested to please get themselves tested !

— Amitabh Bachchan (@SrBachchan) July 11, 2020

details.title: 1,417 new coronavirus cases detected in Pune, 29 deaths
details.content: Pune district reported a single-day highest spike of 1,417 new coronavirus patients since previous evening which took its case count to 37,414 on Saturday, a health official said. The death toll in the district reached 1,036 with 29 patients succumbing to the infection. "Of 1,417 cases, 826 are from Pune Municipal Corporation limits, which now has 26,719 patients. However, 808 patients were also discharged from hospitals," the official said.

details.title: Amitabh Bachchan is asymptomatic and stable, says Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope
details.content: Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope (Photo | Rajesh Tope Twitter)

details.title: 1,308 new coronavirus cases in Mumbai, 39 deaths
details.content: The coronavirus case tally in Mumbai rose to 91,457 on Saturday with 1,308 new patients found, said the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC). 39 patients died, taking the death toll due to the pandemic in the financial capital of the country to 5,241.

details.title: Abhishek Bachchan also tests coronavirus positive
details.content: Bollywood actor Abhishek Bachchan (File | PTI)

details.title: Vishwajit Rane wishes Amitabh Bachchan speedy recovery
details.content: Goa Health Minister Vishwajit Rane on Saturday wished speedy recovery to Amitabh Bachchan, who has tested positive for coronavirus infection. "I join the whole nation in wishing Shri @SrBachchan a quick recovery. All of India will be praying for your speedy recovery from COVID19. Get well soon!" Rane tweeted.

details.title: Punjabi singer Gurnam Bhullar booked for violating COVID-19 guidelines
details.content: Punjabi singer Gurnam Bhullar and forty-three other people were booked for conducting a video shoot in violation of the administration's COVID-19 guidelines here on Saturday, a statement said. Acting on a tip-off, a team of Patiala Police raided a mall in Rajpura and found that the video shoot was in progress in complete violation of the COVID-19 guidelines, it said.

details.title: Tripura reports second COVID death, 141 more positive cases
details.content: Tripura registered its second COVID-19 death on Saturday when a 72-year-old man succumbed to the disease at a government-run hospital in Agartala, an official said. The coronavirus count in Tripura also rose to 1,932 after 141 more people tested positive for the virus.

details.title: Earlier today both my father and I tested positive for COVID 19: Abhishek Bachchan
details.content:
Earlier today both my father and I tested positive for COVID 19. Both of us having mild symptoms have been admitted to hospital. We have informed all the required authorities and our family and staff are all being tested. I request all to stay calm and not panic. Thank you. 🙏🏽

— Abhishek Bachchan (@juniorbachchan) July 11, 2020

details.title: Rahul Gandhi congratulates Dharavi residents, officials for flattening COVID-19 curve
details.content: A day after the World Health Organisation lauded Mumbai's Dharavi for breaking the chain of COVID-19 transmission, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday congratulated all those responsible for the achievement. At a virtual press conference on Friday, WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said Dharavi, among other places in the world, is an example that shows that even if the outbreak is very intense, it can still be brought under control.
